citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
One dog has been identified at the facility as requiring veterinary care. The facility had not identified the dental issue prior
to the inspection.
A light brown female Maltipoo (microchip #7857) that is approximately 4.5 years old has gum recession and loose teeth
on the upper jaw. Multiple teeth are mobile when minimal pressure applied and there are multiple teeth missing. This
issue was identified while performing the physical examination of the dog when the inspector observed movement in the
teeth with minimum pressure applied to the teeth and gums.
Failure to conduct adequate daily observations to assess the health and well-being of the dogs with direct and frequent
communication to the attending veterinarian can delay treatment and increase severity of health conditions.
The facility contacted the veterinarian at the time of inspection and scheduled an appointment for 3:00 PM on 25-June-
2025.
Correct by ensuring that the animal listed above, and the condition of the animal are reported to the attending veterinarian
so that the animals can be properly examined, diagnosed, and treated. Additionally, ensure that daily observation of
animals is adequate to identify any signs of poor health. Ensure that there is accurate and timely communication of
problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being conveyed to the attending veterinarian. Correct by 5:00 PM, 26-June-
2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
One dog has been identified at the facility as requiring veterinary care. The facility had not identified the dental issue prior 
to the inspection. 
 
A light brown female Maltipoo (microchip #7857) that is approximately 4.5 years old has gum recession and loose teeth 
on the upper jaw. Multiple teeth are mobile when minimal pressure applied and there are multiple teeth missing. This 
issue was identified while performing the physical examination of the dog when the inspector observed movement in the 
teeth with minimum pressure applied to the teeth and gums. 
 
Failure to conduct adequate daily observations to assess the health and well-being of the dogs with direct and frequent 
communication to the attending veterinarian can delay treatment and increase severity of health conditions.  
 
The facility contacted the veterinarian at the time of inspection and scheduled an appointment for 3:00 PM on 25-June-
2025.  
 
Correct by ensuring that the animal listed above, and the condition of the animal are reported to the attending veterinarian 
so that the animals can be properly examined, diagnosed, and treated. Additionally, ensure that daily observation of 
animals is adequate to identify any signs of poor health. Ensure that there is accurate and timely communication of 
problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being conveyed to the attending veterinarian. Correct by 5:00 PM, 26-June-
2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
